member_organisations:
SA - Business Iceland has 6 member associations. The member associations operate on the basis of the different industrial sectors and each of them has the initiative in company matters within its own sector. They are:  
 
Association of Financial Institutions in Iceland (SFF)  
Federation of district heatings, electric utilities, and waterworks in Iceland (Samorka)  
Federation of Trade and Services (SVÞ)    
The Federation of Icelandic Industries (SI)   
Fisheries Iceland (SF)   
The Icelandic Travel Industry Association (SAF)
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Competition, Consumers, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: SA follows developments in various areas related to the EEA and the Single Market as well as promoting the interests of Icelandic businesses abroad.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit: SA - Business Iceland (SA) is a service organization for Icelandic businesses. SA projects include negotiations of collective agreements with unions on wages and working conditions, the advocation of an internationally competitive legal and regulatory environment, and the interpretation and communication of decisions by governmental authorities that directly affect the business environment.
